Q1: What is called when a function is defined inside a class
exp1:
When a function is defined inside a class then it is called Method.
The method is accessible to data that is contained within the class.
Q2: Which of the following is the use of id() function in python
opt2: Id returns the identity of the object
Every object doesn’t have a unique id
exp2: Each object in Python has a unique id. The id() function returns the object’s id.
hint2: Id is a abbreviation for identity
Q3: Suppose list1 is [3,4,5,20,5,25,1,3], what is list1 after list1.pop(1)
exp3: pop(i) removes the ith index element from the list
Q4: What do we use to define a block of code in Python language
exp4:
Python uses indentation to define blocks of code. Indentations are simply spaces or tabs used as an
 indicator that is part of the indent code child. As used in curly braces C, C++, and Java.
hint4: It is used in curly braces C, C++, and Java
exp5: Python language was developed by Guido van Rossum in the Netherlands
